title.narrative: Children and adolescents who are victims or at risk of violence, including armed violence and GBV, receive protection services and strengthen their resilience

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide access to protection, mental health, and psycho-emotional and gender-responsive services to girls, boys and adolescents’ victims of violence and at risk of violence including armed violence, gender-based violence, abuse and exploitation. This UNICEF project provides 1) mental health and psychosocial support (MHPSS) through mobile teams of psychologists and social workers, 2) safe and child-friendly spaces, and 3) front-line worker training in the detection, first aid, referral and gender-responsive support to children and adolescent survivors/at risk of violence among other activities. The project provides assistance to 15,000 people, including 1,000 men, 2,000 women, 12,000 children, and including 2,250 persons with disabilities.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Children and adolescents who are victims or at risk of violence, including armed violence and GBV, receive protection services and strengthen their resilience

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS HONDURAS UNDERFUNDED EMERGENCIES ECONOMIC DISRUPTION 2022

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: Girls, boys and adolescents who are victims or at risk of violence, including armed violence and gender-based violence, in the selected communities have access to protective, mental health and psycho-emotional services, and strengthen their resilience to protect themselves from any type of violence, abuse and exploitation.
# children and adults who have access to safe, accessible, child and gender-sensitive channel to report SEA
# girls, women, boys and men sharing their concerns and asking questions/clarifications to address their needs through established and gender-responsive feedback mechanisms
# women, girls and boys accessing GBV risk mitigation, prevention or response interventions
AP.2b Percentage of affected people who state that they are aware of feedback and complaints mechanisms established for their use”
CP.4 Number of people accessing protection activities and/or services through child-friendly spaces
H.9 Number of people provided with mental health and psycho-social support services
